text:
A temple for Rajiv Gandhi, who was the Prime Minister from 1984 to 1989, is being built in Bihar’s Buxar district, a Congress leader said on Saturday.

The construction of the temple for the scion of the Nehru-Gandhi family started early this month, said Mirtunjay Rai, a Congress leader who, along with other Congressmen, is behind the project.

“The foundation stone was laid and construction work began for the temple at Kathrai village under Rajpur block in Buxar,” he said. The site is about 125 km from here.

A lifesize statue of Rajiv Gandhi will be installed in the temple, said Mr. Rai.

“It is a small gesture for Rajiv Gandhi, a Congress leader who worked hard to develop India,” he added. — IANS
title: Temple for Rajiv Gandhi coming up in Bihar
